node.title: When COVID-19 infiltrated this remote community, so did a 'tidal wave of misinformation'
node.alt: A woman silver hair wearing a black top at an office desk
node.description: Deb Aloisi knew a coronavirus outbreak would challenge the people of Binjari. But what she didn't anticipate was a deluge of messages from the United States.
node.content:
["Deb Aloisi never has\u00a0enough time in the day.", "As chief executive\u00a0of the Binjari Community Aboriginal Corporation, she is frequently attending meetings, solving problems and crafting ways to improve life in Binjari.", "But when COVID-19 hit the town she's called home since 1990, her workload\u00a0increased to a whole new level.\u00a0", "She didn't anticipate\u00a0losing hours of every day\u00a0responding to false claims her people\u00a0were being forced into vaccinations and removed from their homes against their will.", "\"There were some days there where I just [had] my phone on silent and left it in my bedroom and never even brought it out, just worked on my computer rather than listen to all the bullshit\u00a0that was coming out of people's mouths.''", "She said many of the self-described \"concerned citizens\" weren't from Binjari or the Northern Territory.", "\"I was getting calls from Arizona, I think it was \u2014\u00a0or Nevada \u2014 telling me the army was forcing everyone out, like into quarantine, that we were holding down giving them needles,\" she said.", "\"Not only overseas, I was getting them from Melbourne and Sydney.\"", "", "
Binjari is a tight-knit community made up of about 300 residents.(ABC News: Hamish Harty)
", "Misleading content uploaded to various social media sites had been shared thousands of times.", "While fighting misinformation, the Binjari Community Aboriginal Corporation was trying to coordinate the delivery of essential supplies and logistics into a community in the grips of what had become\u00a0a deadly COVID-19 outbreak.", "Ms Aloisi would regularly be talking to community members in quarantine at Howard Springs, comforting and supporting them.", "While she found the personal abuse upsetting, her bigger issue was the persistence of people outside of Binjari making false statements about the pandemic as the community lost an elder.", "\"People were grieving and still it just didn't stop,\" she said.", "So prolific was the material online, NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner to call on \"conspiracy theorists\" to \"please get a life\".", "
Other remote communities faced similar problems
", "Katherine West Health Board chief executive\u00a0Sinon Cooney said his organisation had contended with similar issues for the remote communities they serve.", "\"There's has been lots and lots and lots of misinformation across a lot of different areas, not just vaccination,\" he said.", "\"It was a definite battle for us with social media.", "", "
Mr Cooney said he was not\u00a0prepared for the amount of misinformation targeting remote Territorians.(ABC News: Michael Donnelly)
", "It's what made the response tricky for Katherine West, which\u00a0supports remote communities including Lajamanu, Kalkarindji, Yarralin, Bulla and Pigeon Hole.", "\"People can access information from across the world via social media,\" he said.", "\"It was something that was just really unheard of for us in the bush.\"", "As for helping people who encounter these videos, Mr Cooney said a patient approach\u00a0in language and culturally appropriate responses were the most successful ways to shift\u00a0minds.", "\"There were\u00a0lots of quiet conversations with influential people in community. Quiet conversations, community meetings.\"", "Whether in Binjari, Lajamanu or anywhere else in Australia, Mr Cooney said a key part of the response had to include providing an alternative view to those exposed to misinformation.", "\"Changing that narrative to one that was a more positive one because we do have a highly vulnerable population and vaccination is the number one tool that we have,\" he said."]
